text_section1.text: Herb, don't you think you're interfering with nature?
This forced growing of yours -- this speeding-up of growth in plants! Really, Herb!
That's the big surprise I have for you, Jack! You are not seeing nature in action now!
You're seeing a man-made creation, Jack! Besides me, you're the only one to ever see it!
My Robot Plants
You mean to say --? Herb, that plant! It's a mechanical plant?

text_section2.text: Indeed, Jack! And I daresay even a wandering bee wouldn't know the difference between this and a real plant!

text_section1.text: Then this is a greenhouse of mechanical plants -- such as that gigantic African python vine?

text_section2.text: No, the python vine is real -- as are others here! You are gazing upon a mixture of man and nature -- and only I know which is which!

text_section1.text: Everybody knows about ordinary artificial flowers -- but these mechanical flowers! What about them?

text_section2.text: People can now buy flowers that are imperishable! Yet -- they grow and bud and blossom into beauty like real flowers!

text_section1.text: How do these robot plants work?

text_section2.text: Merely fine mechanisms, set into a timed motion by a small nuclear battery! No more plant-watering for me, Jack -- nor for others!

text_section1.text: But if you made a robot python vine, for example ... a thing that attacks other plants -- you'd create a menace!

text_section2.text: Impossible! My robots are under absolute control!

text_section1.text: But come -- up into the old light house! I have more surprises for you!

text_section2.text: Nothing -- but nothing -- would surprise me now!

text_section1.text: Moments later, up in the tower...

text_section3.text: Blast it, Herb! I don't like this! There's something ominous about it! You'd better go back to watering real plants!

text_section1.text: You're toying with the unknown, Herb -- the unreal! What if some mechanism went wrong? What if...?

text_section2.text: You're an alarmist Jack! My robot plants are simply advanced toys!

text_section1.text: A vague movement commands their attention -- and --
Herb! I think I know what it is!

text_section2.text: Jack -- I now what what it is! Let's get out of here!

text_section1.text: CR-RASH
It won't stop growing!
Down the stars! Hurry, man!
By quick calculation (puff - puff) -- I can determine only (puff - puff!) that radiation escaped from the plant's nuclear battery and...

text_section2.text: Yeah -- and created a giant plant -- with near-human properties! I told you, Herb! I told you!

text_section1.text: Maybe we can figure out a solution! What sort of plant is it?

text_section2.text: You can bet your life on one thing -- it's no lily!

text_section1.text: Herb! It's studying us! Do something!

text_section2.text: I am! I'm trying to think!

text_section1.text: What's the thing up to, Herb?

text_section2.text: Great guns! The thing wants to water us -- like we'd water a plant! Let's get out of here!

text_section1.text: Then suddenly, other tentacle-like vines appear...

text_section3.text: Fantastic! Mother nature has taken a hand in matters! The python vine has run berserk! Another plant is its natural enemy -- and it sensed this thing nearby -- and struck!

text_section1.text: Herb! Your mechanical plant is losing!

text_section2.text: Yes, Jack! Nature is winning out!

text_section1.text: It's all over!

text_section2.text: And I'd hate to think of what an army of such plants would do to mankind!

text_section1.text: Later -- much later...

text_section2.text: It only proves that inventions - merely because they're inventions -- aren't always good, Herb...

text_section1.text: Now that you've rid yourself of those confounded mechanical plants, what do you intend to do next?
This -- just this! Use real plants -- and water them! Yep, Jack -- keep watering them...

text_section2.text: But be careful, Herb! Not too much water! You saw what too much radiation did! The End.
